Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (South Ionian) Middle Wild Goat II pottery closed vessel (oinochoe?); orange clay with much silver mica; white slip (partly peeled); zone of tongues, every third red, at top of shoulder; frieze of grazing wild goats, two part-preserved, to left, zone of floral ornaments (?); filling ornaments: pendant roundel, dot-rosettes; red patches on neck, belly and hind leg of wild goats and on some of the tongues; dividing bands between friezes with added red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: The subject matter of the lower frieze - alternate black and red discs with small 'antennae' - is peculiar.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.059)
